result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • David J. Welsh was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David J. Welsh in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  State gives joint recommendation.  Attorney Martinez agrees.  Attorney Martinez also advises of waiver of preliminary hearing.  Attorney Martinez received the information.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
5 years Probation, concurrent
DNA surcharge $250/sample
6 months Sauk County Jail, with huber privileges. Consecutive to any other sentences or commitments.   Jail to commence March 13, 2015 at 4:30 p.m.  EMP approved, per jail rules.  
Undergo any counseling per agent.
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and drugs unless defendant has a valid Rx and used accordingly.
May not oper. MV w/out a valid DL.
AODA & treatment
48 month Revocation and 48 month IID requirement
$25.00 Blood draw fee
$268.00 costs & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
